description: [Ethiopian Herald] The Ministerial Meeting of Coordinators on the Implementation of the Follow-up Actions of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) has just concluded in Changsha, China. Chinese President Xi Jinping sent a congratulatory letter to the Meeting, pointing out that openness and cooperation are the right path, and mutual benefit and win-win outcomes meet the aspiration of the people.
title: Africa: Unlock Door to Common Development With Key of China-Africa Cooperation

description: [UCT] The University of Cape Town (UCT) has once again claimed its spot among the world's leading universities, ranking in the top 1.3% of institutions worldwide in the 2025 edition of the Center for World University Rankings (CWUR). With a global position of 275th, UCT retains its standing as Africa's highest-ranked university.
title: Africa: UCT Remains Africa's Top University in Latest Global Rankings

description: [FrontPageAfrica] Monrovia -- Internal Affairs Minister, Franklin Sakila Nyumalin, has issued a strong warning over the rising tensions between Guinea and Sierra Leone at the Yengar border, calling the situation a serious threat to regional peace.
title: West Africa: Internal Affairs Minister Alarms Over Guinea-Sierra Leone Border Conflict At Historic AU-Ecowas Border Program Conference

description: [Oxfam] Oxfam is deeply concerned by the outcomes of the G7 Summit in Kananaskis. At a time when urgent global crises demand bold and united action, the summit fell short of delivering the leadership the world needs.
title: Africa: Oxfam Reaction to the 2025 G7 Summit

description: [Vanguard] The price of crude oil, yesterday, dropped marginally to $73 per barrel from $74 per barrel in the international market as the Israel-Iran conflict tension eases.
title: Africa: Israel-Iran Conflict - Crude Oil Prices Drop to $73pb As Tension Eases

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa, -- Africa Conference on Childcare under the theme "Building Partnerships for Accelerating Action towards Quality and Inclusive Childcare in Africa," kicked off in Addis Ababa today.
title: Africa: Africa Conference On Childcare Kicks Off in Addis Ababa

description: [Capital FM] The confirmation of a new agreement between the United States and China, emerging from high-stakes talks in London, has sent ripples through global markets--and rightly so. While the deal falls short of resolving the deep-rooted economic rivalry between the two superpowers, it signals a crucial shift: a move away from escalation toward a more stable and pragmatic engagement.
title: Africa: What the U.S.-China Agreement Means for the World

description: [State Department] Travel Ban; Africa Senior Enlisted Leaders Conference, UNICEF
title: Africa: Department Press Briefing - June 17, 2025

description: [Daily Trust] President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has called for collective action and regional cooperation among African countries in developing Africa's sovereign wealth.
title: Africa: Tinubu Calls for Collective Action to Develop Africa's Sovereign Wealth

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarship, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: The Turbulent Career of Getachew Reda

description: [Nile Post] Today, the world pauses to mark the World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought, an annual reminder of the urgent need to protect and restore land degraded by human activity and climate change.
title: Africa: World Marks Desertification and Drought Day With Renewed Call to Restore Land

description: [Premium Times] Initiatives that support improved solid waste management of marine plastics, while advocating awareness for policy change, must be encouraged.
title: Africa: Overcoming Blue Economy Challenges - Paving the Way for Africa's Renaissance

description: [allAfrica] Cape Town -- The U.S. State Department confirmed that there is no cut-off date for countries to come up with an "action plan" to adhere to the Donald Trump administration's expanded travel ban.
title: Africa: No, Today is Not the Deadline for Countries to Submit U.S. Travel Ban 'Action Plans'

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - June 18, 2025

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Carbon markets could release 1.5 to 2.5 gigatonnes of new emissions annually, fueling more pollution in Africa, a recent report by Power Shift Africa has revealed.
title: Africa: Carbon Markets May Unleash Billions of Tons in Emissions, Power Shift Africa Warns

description: [IPS] United Nations -- Although access to mental health and psychosocial support services is considered a fundamental human right by the United Nations (UN), hundreds of millions of people experience limited or inadequate access to mental health and psychosocial support services.
title: Africa: The Global Mental Health Crisis Surges Amid $200 Billion Funding Gap

description: [Premium Times] "African countries... they're not asking us to pull them up. They're already there. They want us to respect their sovereignty. Treat them as equal partners. And that's what we have been doing," the US General said.
title: Africa: If Nigeria Wins, West Africa Wins, Outgoing Africom Commander Speaks On Insecurity

description: [SciDev.Net] Scidev.Net -- As Africa reckons with shrinking foreign research support and looming health threats, scientists across the continent are pushing for a more self-reliant future.
title: Africa: Q&amp;a - Aid Cuts Call for African Self-Reliance in Research

description: [HRW] Abuja -- Most African Governments Don't Meet Global Funding Benchmarks
title: Africa: Insufficient Domestic Funding Hinders Education Progress

description: [Addis Standard] Addis Abeba- Daily cholera cases in the Amhara Region have declined in recent weeks, according to the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC), which attributed the development to a "coordinated response" implemented jointly with the Ethiopian Public Health Institute (EPHI) and the Amhara Public Health Institute (APHI).
title: Africa: News - Africa CDC Reports Daily Cholera Cases Decline in Amhara, Attributes Progress to Joint Response

description: [Afropop] Akinyemi Ayinoluwa is a Nigerian entertainment lawyer, recently named to Billboard's 2025 Top Music Lawyers list. This honor recognizes him as one of the most influential legal figures shaping today's music industry. Ayinoluwa's firm, Lagos-based Hightower Solicitors, is widely regarded as Africa's premier music law firm, with a client roster that includes some of Afrobeats' most in-demand producers: Magicsticks (Asake, Tiwa Savage), Ragee (Davido, Adekunle Gold), Damie (BNXN, Fave), Rexxie (Burna Boy,
title: Africa: Akinyemi Ayinoluwa Bringing African Music Law Into the 21st Century

description: [The Conversation Africa] The world's most developed economies have also burnt the most oil and coal (fossil fuels) over the years, causing the most climate change damage. Preventing further climate change means a global fossil fuel phase-out must happen by 2050. Climate change mitigation scientists Sven Teske and Saori Miyake analysed the potential for renewable energy in each of the G20 countries. They concluded that the G20 is in a position to generate enough renewable energy to supply the world. For African countries to
title: Africa: G20 Countries Could Produce Enough Renewable Energy for the Whole World - What Needs to Happen
